page.title: 16Country Retreat
page.content: A cob-walled cottage circa 1700 in Kelly church Glebe was sold in 1948. With extension and outbuildings it has been since 1972 home for Scottish Baronet's widow, who left dower house in Ayrshire for health reasons.Aged 75 slight, vivacious with a positive approach to problems of isolation and ill health, she keeps hens, geese, silkies, 2 returned guide dogs and fow terrier. Lets upstairs flat and has twice weekly services of home help. A car driver she shops in Tavistock or Launceston and consults Lifton doctor. Concerned at breakdown of law and order she considers magistrates too lenient favours corpral and capital punishment. Country loving she thinks coursing a menace, but condemns anti bloodsport campaigners' dangerous activities and do gooders, who release mink into the wild.
